intro: Alyssum samium, commonly known as sweet alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing annual or biennial plant that produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant has hairy, gray-green leaves and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often used in garden settings for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Alyssum samium is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
